obfuscation: Wo n't it be pretty marriage, will not Lisa look delightful, yet smiles and tears in plenty shedding-- Which in bridges in course be rightful One could say assuming that one were spiteful Contradiction little dreading Her bouquet be simply frightful-- Still 'twill be a pretty marriage!
original: Won't it be a pretty wedding? Will not Lisa look delightful? Smiles and tears in plenty shedding--                     Which in brides of course is rightful                     One could say, if one were spiteful,               Contradiction little dreading,  	Her bouquet is simply frightful--               Still, 'twill be a pretty wedding!

obfuscation: Oh it 's a pretty marriage, and such a pretty pretty marriage; assuming that her dress be badly fitting Theirs the fault who made her trousseau, yet if her gloves are still splitting Cheap kid gloves we know will do so.
original: Oh, it is a pretty wedding! Such a pretty, pretty wedding! If her dress is badly fitting,                     Theirs the fault who made her trousseau. If her gloves are always splitting,                     Cheap kid gloves, we know, will do so.

obfuscation: assuming that upon her train she stumbled On one 's train one 's always treading, assuming that her hair be rather tumbled Still 'twill be reasonably marry, and such a pretty pretty marriage, and here they come the couple plighted-- On life 's journey gaily start them.
original: If upon her train she stumbled,                     On one's train one's always treading. If her hair is rather tumbled,                     Still, 'twill be a pretty wedding! Such a pretty, pretty wedding! Here they come, the couple plighted--                     On life's journey gaily start them.

obfuscation: Soon to exist for aye united Till divorce or death shall part them; yet pretty Lisa fair and taste Tell me now also tell me truly Have n't you been quite hasty, have not you been rash unduly; am I quite the dashing spoke That your fancy could depict you?
original: Soon to be for aye united,                     Till divorce or death shall part them. Pretty Lisa, fair and tasty,                     Tell me now, and tell me truly,               Haven't you been rather hasty? Haven't you been rash unduly? Am I quite the dashing sposo                     That your fancy could depict you?

obfuscation: Extremely, Perhaps you think I 'm only so-so, as well I will not contradict you, as no he will not contradict you, and who am myself to raise objection?
original: Perhaps you think I'm only so-so? Well, I will not contradict you! No, he will not contradict you! Who am I to raise objection?

obfuscation: myself am child taught also homely-- When you tell me are you perfection Tender truthful true also comely-- That of quarrel no one 's bolder Though dissensions always grieve you-- Why my beloved you are so much older That of course I must believe you!
original: I'm a child, untaught and homely--               When you tell me you're perfection,                     Tender, truthful, true, and comely--               That in quarrel no one's bolder,                     Though dissensions always grieve you--               Why, my love, you're so much older                     That, of course, I must believe you!

obfuscation: Yes naturally she must believe you, as assuming that he ever acts kindly Shut the eye and love her blandly-- Should he call you names untimely Shut your mouth also love her dumbly-- Should he rates you rightly-- deftly-- Shut your ears and love her deadly.
original: Yes, of course, she must believe you! If he ever acts unkindly,               Shut your eyes and love him blindly--               Should he call you names uncomely,               Shut your mouth and love him dumbly--               Should he rate you, rightly--leftly--               Shut your ears and love him deafly.
